subject: Re: [junit] Component Test?
msgSnippet: Different types can encapsulate either technical or business knowledge. The differences between the two are dependent on functionality. For example if the
messageBody:
Different types can encapsulate either technical or business knowledge. The differences between the two are dependent on functionality.

For example if the component provides only a benefit to the developer e.g. a TCP/IP communication library then the component is categorized as technical. Business components provide a benefit to the developer and end-user by encapsulating business knowledge. Typical examples include address formatting and credit card validation components.


I suggest to write your Own scripts for testing components and many tools available like Borland JBuilder/Bean Tester.

Testing has to cover for safe both Functional and Load minimum.

Regards,
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
M.Madan Mohan Ramarao
Technical Manager
VisualSoft Technologies Ltd. Hyderabad, India
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----- Original Message -----
From: Thiago Kuma
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, February 26, 2004 2:37 AM
Subject: [junit] Component Test?


Someone knows component test tools?
Thanks.
Kuma.
